intro: Gastrolobium huegelii, commonly known as the Grey Box, is a shrub native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its grey-green, narrow leaves and produces small, yellow flowers in spring. The plant is part of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and it has a deep root system that helps it survive in dry conditions. It is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. Gastrolobium huegelii is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in native habitats.
